flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: During this project we will use the Arduino developer platform to build and program LED dice. Using only a push-button, 7 LEDs, a handful of resistors, and an Arduino, you can bring your dice games into the 21st century! (Oh, and Hi-power LEDs make it look cool too.)
guide.introduction_rendered: During this project we will use the Arduino developer platform to build and program LED dice. Using only a push-button, 7 LEDs, a handful of resistors, and an Arduino, you can bring your dice games into the 21st century! (Oh, and Hi-power LEDs make it look cool too.)

lines.text: Insert your LEDs into the board in the traditional dice pattern.
lines.text_raw: Insert your LEDs into the board in the traditional dice pattern.

lines.text: Next, place the resistors on the board so that one end of each resistor will connect with the anode(+) of each corresponding LED. Make sure the other lead from the resistor is in a place where it will later be able to connect to a wire that will connect with the arduino.
